data.title: Dorothea "Dottie" B. Dickinson Obituary 2015
data.meta_description: Dorothea "Dottie" B. (Gade) Dickinson, 96, of the Plantsville section of Southington, died peacefully surrounded by her family on Wednesday, Sept. 16, 2015 at Apple Rehab Coccom...
data.text:
Dorothea "Dottie" B. (Gade) Dickinson, 96, of the Plantsville section of Southington, died peacefully surrounded by her family on Wednesday, Sept. 16, 2015 at Apple Rehab Coccomo in Meriden. She was the loving wife of the late Henry R. Dickinson for 63 years.

Born in Meriden on January 22, 1919 to the late Richard and Clarice (Nevin) Gade, she had been a Plantsville resident since 1952.

Mrs. Dickinson worked as the school lunch director for the town of Southington for many years. She was a longtime member of the First Lutheran Church in Southington. She also served as matron of the Eastern Star in Southington.

Dottie is survived by two sons and daughters-in-law, Richard and Judy Dickinson of Meriden and Gary and Linda Dickinson of North Haven, 10 grandchildren and 9 great-grandchildren. She is also survived by her brother John Gade of Meriden and many nieces and nephews. She was predeceased by her two brothers, Lawrence Gade and Norman Gade and her sister Clarice Knowles.

Dorothea's family would like to thank Linda and her staff at Apple Rehab Coccomo for the kindness and care that they provided for her.

In lieu of flowers, donations in Dorothea's memory may be made to the Alzheimer's Resource Center of Connecticut, 1261 S. Main St., Plantsville, CT 06479 or to the First Lutheran Church, 232 Bristol St., Southington, CT 06489.

Calling hours will be held on Sunday, September 20, 2015 from 2 - 5 p.m. with a funeral service at 4 p.m. at the Plantsville Funeral Home, 975 S. Main St., Plantsville. Burial will be private and at the convenience of the family. For online condolences and directions, please visit www.plantsvillefuneralhome.com.

FUNERAL SERVICES

In lieu of flowers, donations in Dorothea's memory may be made to the Alzheimer's Resource Center of Connecticut, 1261 S. Main St., Plantsville, CT 06479 or to the First Lutheran Church, 232 Bristol St., Southington, CT 06489.

Calling hours will be held on Sunday, September 20, 2015 from 2 - 5 p.m. with a funeral service at 4 p.m. at the Plantsville Funeral Home, 975 S. Main St., Plantsville. Burial will be private and at the convenience of the family.
